login.title: Log in
login.link_expired: The email you clicked has expired. Please request a new one.
login.welcome:
Language Depot is a hosting service for [FieldWorks (FLEx)](https://software.sil.org/fieldworks/), \
[Language Forge](https://languageforge.org/), [OneStory Editor](https://software.sil.org/onestoryeditor) and [WeSay](https://software.sil.org/wesay/) projects. \
It is provided as a service to language communities by [SIL Language Technology](https://software.sil.org/) and \
the [Linguistics Institute at Payap University](https://li.payap.ac.th/) in Chiang Mai, Thailand.

create.title: Create Project
create.code_too_short: Project code must be at least 4 characters
create.code_invalid: Project code can only include lowercase a-z, digits and '-', and cannot start with '-'
create.language_code_too_short: Language code must be at least 2 characters
create.language_code_invalid: Language code can only include lowercase a-z, digits and '-', and cannot start with '-'
create.name: Name
create.name_description: E.g. the name of the language you're working on
create.requested: Your request for project {name} has been submitted.

filter.title: Project filters
filter.select_user_from_table: To filter projects for a specific user, select the user from the user table:

confidential.label: This project is confidential. The safety of project members is a security concern.
confidential.description: Only project members and administrators will be able to see this project. For more information see [Project Confidentiality](https://scribehow.com/shared/Project_Confidentiality__s6TX8_wFQ1ejVpH1s5Bsmw?referrer=documents).
confidential.suggestions: Consider using an alias for the project, project members and any other identifying information in the project. (For similar reasons to those mentioned for [confidential Paratext projects](https://paratext.org/paratext-help-and-support/registry-training-and-help/confidential-projects/).)

project_page.confirm_remove: Would you like to remove {userName} from this project?

get_project.instructions_header: To {isEmpty, select, true { set up } other { get } } this project with {type, select, FL_EX { FLEx } WE_SAY { WeSay } other { (e.g.) FLEx } } {mode, select, manual { manually} other { }}
get_project.instructions_flex:
1. In the "Send/Receive" menu click "Get Project from colleague…"
\
1. In the "Receive project" dialog box, click "Internet"
\
1. In the "Get Project From Internet" dialog box, enter your "Login" ({login}) and "Password" for Language Depot and click "Log in"
\
1. In the "Project ID" field that appears, select "{code}"
\
1. Enter a "Name for the folder on your computer" (e.g. "{name}")
get_project.instructions_flex_empty:
1. [Download FLEx](https://software.sil.org/fieldworks/download/) onto your computer.
\
1. Open the FLEx application and select "Create a new project...".
\
1. Fill in the required information: name of project, name for the folder (e.g. "{name}"), etc. Then click "Finish".
\
1. After the new project opens, click on "Send/Receive" -> "Send this Project for the first time".
\
1. Click on "OK (I have the master project)".
\
1. Click on "Settings..." and enter your Language Depot "Login" ({login}) and "Password".
\
1. Click Log in, then select the Project ID ({code}) from the drop-down menu.
\
1. Click on Internet. This will initiate the first Send/Receive.
get_project.instructions_wesay:
1. Launch 'WeSay Configuration Tool'
\
1. Click 'Get from Internet'
\
1. In the 'Project ID' field type: "{code}"
\
1. In the 'Login' field type: "{login}".\ Note: A bug in WeSay means you can't type the @ symbol for an email.  The workaround is to type %40 in place of @. 
\
1. In the 'Password' field type your password
\
1. Enter a "Name for the folder on your computer" (e.g. "{name}")
\
1. Click 'Download'
get_project.instructions_wesay_empty:
1. [Download WeSay](https://software.sil.org/wesay/download/) onto your computer.
\
1. Open WeSay and select "Create a new blank project...".
\
1. Fill in the required information: project language and name of project (e.g. "{name}"), etc. Then click "Finish".
\
1. Add some words if you want
\
1. Click "Send/Receive"
\
1. Click on "Settings..."
\
1. In the "Name to show in change history" field make sure your name is spelled correctly
\
1. In the "Project ID" field type: "{code}"
\
1. In the "Login" field type: "{login}".\ Note: A bug in WeSay means you can't type the @ symbol for an email.  The workaround is to type %40 in place of @. 
\
1. In the "Password" field type your password
\
1. Click on "OK" to close the "Settings..." dialog
\
1. Click on "Internet". This will initiate the first Send/Receive.
get_project.label: {isEmpty, select, true { Set up } other { Get } } project

\
If you don't see a dialog or already closed it, click the button below:
